scenes.background: [Monica] looks up from her papers, a bit exasperated, while [Bob] leans back in his chair, arms crossed.
scenes.description: 'Bob, I know you're concerned, but I'm handling it. Can we trust each other to do our parts?'

options.text: Trust is important, Monica. Let's all agree on what needs to be done next.
options.analysis: You emphasized the importance of trust and collaboration, showing good social skills and perception, though your self-regulation could be stronger.

options.text: Monica, maybe Bob just needs some reassurance. Can you give a quick update?
options.analysis: You acknowledged Monica's efforts while addressing Bob's concerns, demonstrating empathy and social skills.

options.text: Monica, if you're handling it, why is Bob still worried?
options.analysis: You challenged Monica's statement, potentially creating tension but showing social skill in addressing underlying issues.
